text:
Hi! I have written a custom code inside of a deal-based workflow.

The block outputs a HubSpot_owner_id. This is the owner of a meeting object that is associated with the deal that is enrolled in the workflow. The deal owner is currently unassigned.

I now want to use this HubSpot_owner_id (output from the code block) and copy it to the deal property "HubSpot_owner_id (a.k.a. Deal owner) that is enrolled in the workflow.

Any idea if this is possible? It doesn't allow me to do it
Unsure if this is still the case but is the output a number or string? If so it has to be an enumeration of all the owner ids.
That did the trick! Thank you very much <@U04FNHJ0U2J>

Hi @team
Sales Executive inputs the following:
• Potential Invoiced Revenue: $1,0000 - custom property i have for this
• Project Number of Months: 10 - custom property i have for this
• Project Start Month / Year: March 2023  -custom property i have for this
After these inputs have been completed, HubSpot will create the following:
• HubSpot will create 10 fields (to correspond to the number of months) 
• HubSpot will label those fields with the appropriate Month and Year. In this case, the project 
• is 10 months and starts in March 2023, so HubSpot will dynamically create the following fields: 
1. March 2023 
2. April 2023 
3. May 2023 
4. June 2023 
5. July 2023 
6. August 2023 
7. September 2023 
8. October 2023 
9. November 2023 
10. December 2023

Is this Job is possible with workflow OR how could i achieve this Can anyone help me ?
HI <@U0157R7AQ84> , it seems like nobody has replied to my question. Any chance you can raise it internally?
